intro: Tragia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow and purple flowers, which bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant has hairy, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils. Tragia bicolor is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
